Author: jl777c#5810
Content: with 5% rewards that actually gives a negative inflation rate, during the user acquisition phase, not sure why people want even more monetization

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the more fees, the less users

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so saying you want more fees to get more cashflow is backwards

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: less fees until you have millions and millions of active users, then start adding fees in ways that dont hurt the usage. this CANNOT be designed ahead of time before you have many active users to verify that indeed adding some fee doesnt hurt usage

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so, no, i dont worry about what parking spot in Paris I would use, when I am still driving on the highways in Spain

Author: Malti#3948
Content: awesome conversation

Author: Malti#3948
Content: thx!

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: i know the lambo/moon crowd is very confused by this long term thinking

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: and many "investors" are sure that more monetization now is the best thing ever

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: which actually works to our advantage as these fees are paid by users and what users who are used to all the free stuff on the internet will start paying for blockchain stuff?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: for things that have an established price, like trading commission, we undercut it and then discount it

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: for basic usage, we make faucets to cover the txfees needed

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: such a model is required for ANY chance of mass adoption. anybody that thinks otherwise is also believing that a pay per search strategy should have been used by google, when it was competing against yahoo and other search engines. imagine where google would be now if they used that strategy? probably some subscription services at public libraries

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: this is why i am very happy with the nSPV development. it will allow a 3 second onboarding of new users, as that is another requirement for mass adoption. nobody will be putting up with a gigabyte download to do transactions

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content:
`the only true requirement of cryptos is to replace the fiat.`
@sφldat That's a *want* not a *requirement*
The requirements of a cryptocurrency are:
secured by cryptography (crypto)
exchange of value (currency)

nothing more, nothing less
